embed: <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/Mv3xgBQJPaE?version=3&f=videos&app=youtube_gdata"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/Mv3xgBQJPaE?version=3&f=videos&app=youtube_gdata" allowscriptaccess="always" height="344" width="425" allowfullscreen="true" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"></embed></object>
summary:
Graphs are everywhere - from your distributed source code control to Twitter
analytics. This session presents a set of three problems and shows how they
can be decomposed into operations on graphs, and then demonstrates solutions
using the various graph libraries available for (or accessible to) Python.
title: Graph Processing in Python
